sentence.text: Genome-wide association studies have identified genomic loci, whose single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) predispose to prostate cancer (mitochondrial transport).
The expression of melanosome transport in primary prostate tumors was significantly lower in those with the G compared with the T allele and correlated significantly with AR protein.
Higher melanophilin level in prostate tissue of patients with a favorable mitochondrial transport risk profile points out a tumor-suppressive effect.
